body_html:
@asimshankar

Thanks friends. I load the model one time... and the "classify(BufferedImage image)" is called every frame with motion captured on IP camera.

see the example:

public class TensorflowImageTypeClassifier {
	
	public static boolean			INITIALIZED 		= false;
	private static float			MIN_SCORE		= 0.8f;
	private static String[]			LABELS			= null;
	private static			SavedModelBundle	MODEL	= null;

	static {
		try {
			
			LABELS = loadLabels();
			MODEL = loadModel();
			
			if(LABELS != null && MODEL != null) INITIALIZED = true;
			
		} catch (Exception e) {
			ConsoleLogging.logError(log, "[!] Error while loading models, labels and configurations", e);
		}
	}

	public List<TensorflowImageTypeModel> classify(BufferedImage image) {
		try {
			if (!INITIALIZED) {
				ConsoleLogging.logError(log, "[!] Classification process cannot be initialized", null);
				return null;
			}
			
			List<TensorflowImageTypeModel> modelsList = new ArrayList<TensorflowImageTypeModel>(); 

			int width = image.getWidth();
			int height = image.getHeight();

			List<Tensor<?>> outputs = null;

			try (Tensor<UInt8> input = makeImageTensor(image, width, height)) {
				outputs = MODEL
						.session()
						.runner()
						.feed("image_tensor", input)
						.fetch("detection_scores")
						.fetch("detection_classes")
						.fetch("detection_boxes")
						.run();
			}catch (Exception e) {
				ConsoleLogging.logError(LogManager.getLogger(TensorflowImageTypeClassifier.class), "Error making image tensor. Check file path", e);
			}
